extract.html: Consider one mole of ideal gas undergoing a reversible isothermal expansion at temperature T from volume V1 to V2.

questions.prompt: Q1. Write the expression for work done by the gas in reversible isothermal expansion.
questions.hint: Integral of p dV with p = nRT/V.

questions.prompt: Q2. For n=1 mol, T=300 K, V1=0.010 m³, V2=0.020 m³, compute W (J). Use R=8.314.
Q3. During isothermal expansion of an ideal gas, how do ΔU, Q, and W relate?
